Detailed Description

The RequestVars class is used to store request variables of both GET and POST types. Each variable is stored in a object, Variable, that holds the value and the type. The name of the variable is the key in a local associative array (hash).
Author:
Bas van Gaalen
Since:
1.0

Member Function Documentation

RequestVars.set ( $  sName,
$  sValue = null,
$  sType = null 
)

Set a request name/value pair (will be used in GET or POST). Can either set "a=b" or seperated name/value variables.

Parameters:
$sName string Name of variable or complete variable if value is null.
$sValue mixed Value of variable, when string, or null.
$sType string Type, either GET or POST, default to GET (enum type would be nice...) The type is optional. If this is a new variable, the default GET type will be used. If this is an existing variable and the type is not explicitely provided, the previous type will be preserved.
Returns:
bool True if set ok, false on failure ("a=b" assignment not found).
Since:
1.0
